intro: Orobus inconspicuus, commonly known as the small milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant has slender, branched stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. It produces a milky sap that is toxic to many animals, including livestock. Orobus inconspicuus thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments.
